electroMechanicalLogic

Class RelayBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • electroMechanicalLogic.RelayBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISimulatedCircuit
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Buffer, Inverter

    abstract class RelayBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISimulatedCircuit
    Provides basic functionality for all relays in the simulation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static byte InputMaskOut
      A bit mask that can be applied to the relay's state to determine whether power is flowing to the relay's input terminal.
      protected static byte PowerMaskOut
      A bit mask that can be applied to the relay's state to determine whether power is flowing to the relay's power terminal.
      protected byte state

      RelayBase()

      void setInput(boolean value) 
      void setPower(boolean value)
      Sets a value indicating whether power is flowing to the circuit or not.
      void step()
      Causes the simulated circuit to process all of its inputs to yield its outputs.

      • setInput

        public final void setInput(boolean value)

      • setPower

        public final void setPower(boolean value)
        Description copied from interface: ISimulatedCircuit
        Sets a value indicating whether power is flowing to the circuit or not. All electrical circuits require power to operate. For the purposes of our simulation it is assumed that all circuits are connected to a common ground to complete the circuit.
        Specified by:
        setPower in interface ISimulatedCircuit
        Parameters:
        value - true to indicate that power is flowing to the circuit; false to indicate that it is not.

      • step

        public final void step()
        Description copied from interface: ISimulatedCircuit
        Causes the simulated circuit to process all of its inputs to yield its outputs.
        Specified by:
        step in interface ISimulatedCircuit
